Sentence: The UnitedHealth Group said its former chief executive entered into an options repricing agreement with the company to avoid a potential tax liability.
Options Developments at 2 Companies
UnitedHealth Group, the health-insurance giant, said on Monday it would acquire Sierra Health Services for $2.6 billion, or $43.50 in cash per share, to help it expand in the fast-growing Southwest.
Sierra provides health benefits and services to 310,000 members in Nevada and 320,000 customers throughout the United States.
UnitedHealth to Buy Sierra Health for $2.6 Billion
The $2.6 billion purchase will give UnitedHealth, the nation's largest health insurance company, its first managed care presence in Nevada.
UnitedHealth Buys Sierra, Adding Western Customers

The American Medical Association asked the Justice Department on Monday to block the UnitedHealth Group‘s proposed $2.6 billion purchase of Sierra Health Services, saying the deal would be anticompetitive.
The A.M.A.

estimated that if the merger were completed, UnitedHealth would control 78 percent of the market for health maintenance organizations in Nevada and 95 percent of the market in the Las Vegas-Paradise area.
A.M.A.
Opposes UnitedHealth Deal for Sierra

Pennsylvania’s two largest health insurers agreed on Wednesday to merge in a deal that had been in the works for years and gives the two nonprofits control over most of the state’s health insurance market.

The boards of Independence Blue Cross of Philadelphia and Highmark of Pittsburgh separately approved a merger that would create the nation’s third-largest health insurer behind the UnitedHealth Group and Wellpoint.
Pennsylvania Merger Creates Giant Health Insurer

Horton, First Data, Gannett, Google, Merck, Merrill Lynch, Nokia, Schering-Plough, Southwest Airlines, UnitedHealth Group and Wyeth (Thursday); Caterpillar, Honeywell, McDonald’s, SAP, Schlumberger and Xerox (Friday).

to Settle Inquiry for $400 Million
